Summary A career HR professional – a father, friend, coach, mentor, general athlete, program manager, problem solver and a start-up guy in the HR space ! Presently, Director and Head of Google People Services for Google, APAC. 
 
Previous roles at Google include managing a Program Management office for People Operations in the APAC region, focusing on People Ops Strategy and Operations and managing People Programs in India, a function focused on Employment Branding and Talent Outreach.  
 
DNP brings with him experience in Staffing, Staffing Process Re - engineering, Campus relations, hiring and Programs, Talent Planning & Research, HR Operations, Employee Engagement, Global Immigrations, Employment and Internal Branding, Internal Communications, HR Analytics and Diversity.He considers himself a “ start-up” Human Resources leader, for experience in setting up teams and functions, across country, region or a global scale.  
 
Before joining Google in August 2006, he was working as the Head, Global Entry Level Hiring and Campus Relations for Infosys Technologies Ltd. His experience includes Employee Relations, Immigrations and HR Operations, all of which he handled at various points in time of his career with Infosys; across India and United States. 
 
His interests include sports (formerly, national level Basketball player, coach and sports administrator), music and books (sports biographies is a pet read). 
 
He is passionate about mentoring and career coaching and is active on both fronts.  
 
DNP was chosen as and awarded the Best HR Leader in the Tenth Annual Singapore HRM Awards, 2013 – a pre-eminent HR Awards in Singapore, and featured as one of the best HR leaders to watch for in 2013, in a cover story by HRM Asia in the January 2013 issue. 
 
He serves on the HR Core Advisory Committee for NASSCOM - India, the HR Advisory team for SPRING, Singapore and on the Board of Management Studies of T.A. Pai Management Institute, Manipal – India.

In his role as Director of Google People Services in APAC, for one of the three global hubs, he ensures the operational integrity of the company's people process, and partners with the cross-functional teams to bring innovation in the way the company uses technology to attract, retain and grow Googlers worldwide. 
 
Google People Services (GPS) is the Staffing, Talent Outreach Programs, Services and Program Management group within People Operations that specializes in finding the best talent for Google and enable their life cycle within Google by delivering 100+ operational services, reporting solutions, Program Implementation and managing Google’s Contingent Workforce Program. Program Manager and Head - People Technology and Operations, APAC Google June 2010  –  November 2012  (2 years 6 months) Singapore Member of the Google APAC HR Leadership Team. In the role of Director and Head of People Technology and Operations in APAC, ensures the operational integrity of the company's people process, and partner with the cross-functional teams to bring innovation in the way the company uses technology to attract, retain and grow Googlers worldwide.  
 
People Technology and Operations (PTO) is the services and Program Management group within People Operations that specializes in implementing change management programs and delivering 100+ operational services, reporting solutions, tools and technology that support current and future Googlers, as well as alumni Xooglers. People Operations Program Manager - JAPAC Google January 2009  –  June 2010  (1 year 6 months) Singapore Member of the Google APAC HR Leadership Team. Managed a Program Management office for People Operations in the APAC region, focusing on People Ops Strategy and Operations and managing People Programs in Asia, a function focused on Employment Branding and Talent Outreach. Responsibilities included Central Staffing, Employment and Internal Branding, People Ops Communications, HR Analytics and Diversity. People Programs Manager - Google India Google August 2006  –  December 2008  (2 years 5 months) Bengaluru Area, India Was responsible for managing People Programs for Google India. The role was pan-India in nature; my team (of 10) and I worked across businesses and locations in India. In sync with the mission of People Programs across Google, we anticipated the demands and meet the requirements of the company's rapid expansion throughout the world. The team helps Google's recruiting and HR processes work effectively and extol Google's many virtues as an employer.  
 
My role encompassed responsibilities in two broad paradigms, whose objectives are:  
 
1.	Build an Effective Employment Brand for Google India: Involved engagements across the following key functional areas: University Programs, Branding and Communication and Events / Conferences and Seminars.  
 
Conceptualize, design and execute: engagement plans with engineering and Non-Engineering Schools of choice; various sources of employment branding and communication that will provide a platform to promote / enhance Google employment brand. 
 
2.	Developed and managed programs for Google India People Ops: Programs are by nature organizational, functional or team specific. Mostly, these engagements happened in a cross-functional team within HR (and sometimes business); enables strengthening Program Management capabilities within People Ops, India.  
 
Often, my role involved playing a role of in internal consultant; to identify issues in staffing or HR, and work towards providing (and most times, executing) immediate problem solving measures and long term solutions. Head - Global Entry Level Hiring and Campus Relations Infosys Technologies Limited 1999  –  2006  (7 years) Bengaluru Area, India & Fremont, California Roles handled : 
 
1. Head – Global Entry Level Hiring and Campus Relations and Head – HR Operations and Business Process Management, December 2004 to June 2006 
2. Manager – Entry Level Hiring, Campus relations, Planning and Research, March 2002 – November 2004 
3.Associate Manger – Immigrations and Compliance, Employee Relations; February 2000 to March 2002 
4. Senior Associate - HRD; April 1999 to January 2000 
 
Career highlights : 
 
•	Part of the identified core leadership at Infosys (Tier -3 Leader, less than 1% of the company). 
•	2 time winner of the prestigious Infosys Excellence Award: 
➢	Internal Customer Delight – 2002 
➢	Innovation for Initiatives – 2005 
•	2 times on the Chairman’s List Stock Option grant for outstanding performance 
•	Member of the Talent Management Executive Council, Infosys 
•	Key contributor to talent scalability at Infosys, 10738 employees in FY’02 to 44,658 as on March 31, 2006. 
•	Core Committee Member, Infosys “Campus Connect “Initiative, a global Industry Academia program launched by Infosys in 2004.  
•	Consistently scored higher than Infosys Average in 360 degree appraisals in the last 4 years in most of the parameters of measurement  
•	Handled a team size of 30 and worked with people in multiple geographies from diverse cultural backgrounds as a leader and also in various cross functional global teams. 
 
Cross Functional Organization wide programs: 
 
•	Contributed to the annual Infosys Strategic Planning process to develop new “Infy Plus” themes for four years – 2002 to 2006 
•	Member, Operations Planning Council, Infosys – 2003-2006 
•	Contributed to development of a long term HR Strategy as part of the HR Leadership Team 
•	Was one of the authorized Infy HR representatives to present Infosys HR and hiring credentials in a “flat world” and engage with clients (from Fortune 500 and Global 2000 list) Director, Google People Services, APAC Google December 2012  – Present (2 years 8 months) Singapore Member of the global Google People Services Leadership team and Google APAC HR Leadership team.
